page.title: 08WEATHER OF PORT GLASGOW
page.content: Over the past 30 years the average annual{rainfall}is about 1380mm and also the average monthly rainfall is about 115mm.May,June and July are the driest parts of the season with only 75mm of rain per month.The wettest part of the year being the months of January,November and December, with the rainfall averaging from 160mm to 200mm.Temperature varies from 3'C to about 18'C during the year with the coldest days come during the months of January,Febuary,November and December. The hottest and most enjoyable months of the year with{temperatures}varying from 14'C to 18'C are the months of June, July and August. On the whole Port Glasgow has a fairly average climate for the West coast of Scotland. The climate of the area influences the{ecology}greatly.
